{{cpp/chrono/utc_clock/title|1=to_sys}}
{{cpp/chrono/utc_clock/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|since=c++20|1=
template&lt; class Duration &gt;
static std::chrono::sys_time&lt;std::common_type_t&lt;Duration, std::chrono::seconds&gt;&gt;
    to_sys( const std::chrono::utc_time&lt;Duration&gt;&amp; t );
}}
{{dcl end}}

Converts a {{tt|utc_time}} {{c|t}} to a {{tt|sys_time}} representing the same point in time (if possible).

If {{c|t}} represents a time point during a leap second insertion, the last representable value of {{tt|sys_time}} prior to the insertion of the leap second is returned. In all other cases, {{c|1=utc_clock::from_sys(utc_clock::to_sys(t)) == t}}.

===Return value===
A {{tt|sys_time}} representing the same point in time as {{c|t}}, or the last representable value prior to the insertion of the leap second if {{c|t}} represents a time point during a leap second insertion.
